EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as central storage.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-3.0, y=19.0) for iron smelting.
• Stone Furnace at (x=-4.0, y=21.0) for copper plate production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=0.5, y=21.5) with drop at (x=0.5, y=20.5).

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System) at base configuration
Consists of:
• Lab at (x=-7.5, y=18.5) dedicated to automation research.
• Boiler – formerly placed at (x=-5.5, y=24.0); picked up for relocation and now held in inventory pending a buildable placement.
• Offshore Pump – formerly at (x=-7.5, y=25.5); also picked up during relocation attempts and currently in inventory.
• Electricity Group with small electric poles at positions (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5), (x=3.5, y=19.5) and (x=1.5, y=22.5).
• Dual PipeGroups forming the fluid network:
 – Group 1 at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) and (x=-12.5, y=18.5)
 – Group 2 at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) and (x=-2.5, y=21.5)
• Steam Engines:
 – Steam Engine at (x=7.5, y=35.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: [not connected to power network, no input liquid, no fluid present in connections]).
 – Steam Engine at (x=8.5, y=20.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; warnings: [not connected to power network, no input liquid, no fluid present in connections]).
 – Steam Engine at (x=-13.5, y=16.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; connection to boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) failed).
 – Steam Engine at (x=-14.5, y=13.5) (status: NOT_CONNECTED; connection to boiler at (x=-5.5, y=24.0) failed).

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of:
• Assembling Machine at (x=1.5, y=19.5) reconfigured to Iron Gear Wheel production.
• Burner Inserter at (x=1.5, y=17.5).
• Input Chest at (x=2.5, y=17.5) for resource input.
• Output Chest at (x=1.5, y=21.5) dispatching finished products.
• Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-5.5, y=21.5).
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=0.5, y=17.5) linking outputs.
• Additional Burner Inserters at (x=2.5, y=16.5) and (x=3.5, y=17.5).

### Copper Extraction System (adjacent to the copper smelting furnace)
Consists of:
• Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=23.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=22.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=24.5).
• Copper Buffer Chest at (x=-3.5, y=26.5).
• Chest Extraction Burner Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=27.5) with pickup at (x=-3.5, y=26.5) and drop at (x=-3.5, y=28.5).
• Belt Source Inserter at (x=-3.5, y=25.5).

### Extraction Belt Depot at position (x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the belt depot.
• Dedicated Transport Belt Segment at (x=4.5, y=15.5) for copper plate conveyance.
• Depot Burner Inserter at (x=3.5, y=14.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=3.5, y=13.5).

### Belt Connection Target Setup for Copper Extraction
Consists of:
• Extraction Source: Wooden Chest at (x=3.5, y=15.5).
• Extraction Inserter at (x=4.5, y=15.5) with pickup at (x=3.5, y=15.5) and drop at (x=5.5, y=15.5).
• Manual Transport Belt Chain comprising:
 – Horizontal segments at (x=7.5, y=15.5) and (x=8.5, y=15.5) [note: blocked placement at (x=6.5, y=15.5)].
 – Vertical segments at (x=8.5, y=14.5), (x=8.5, y=13.5), (x=8.5, y=12.5) and (x=8.5, y=11.5) [note: occupancy error at (x=8.5, y=10.5)].
• New Target Inserter at (x=8.5, y=9.5) with pickup at (x=8.5, y=10.5) and drop at (x=8.5, y=8.5).
• Belt Chain Burner Inserter Refueling Subsystem comprising:
 – Burner Inserters at (x=6.5, y=9.5), (x=7.5, y=9.5) and (x=8.5, y=9.5) operating at reduced fuel levels.
 – Additional Burner Inserters at (x=3.5, y=14.5) and (x=5.5, y=14.5).

────────────────────────
ERROR TIPS
• Position Object and Candidate Retrieval Errors:
 – Avoid calling Position objects as functions. The TypeError encountered (e.g., "'Position' object is not callable") indicates misusage when searching for water patches and retrieving candidate centers.
 – Ensure that candidate retrieval functions (like nearest_buildable) are invoked correctly with proper position references.

• Buildable Candidate Validation Failures:
 – Multiple candidate positions for Offshore Pump and Boiler—whether from water-resource searches, manual selections, offset calculations, or grid searches—have been flagged as not buildable. Verify clearance, adjust search radii, and refine offset criteria to secure valid build areas.
 – Revalidate candidate positions immediately after any inventory or relocation actions to avoid obsolete references.

• Water Resource Detection Failures:
 – Occurrences such as failing to obtain a water patch (e.g., in region (100,100) with the error "No water at the specified location") require verifying water resource availability within the target region before initiating candidate searches.

• Pipeline Connection Sequencing:
 – Repeated skips in pipe connection routines due to missing entity placements highlight the need to complete successful candidate placements for critical entities before connecting pipelines.
 – Synchronize candidate placement outcomes with subsequent pipe connection attempts to ensure cohesive structure assembly.

• Prior Validation and Relocation Protocols:
 – Maintain rigorous STEAM ENGINE and general candidate position validation by confirming candidate positions are free of obstructions using can_place_entity checks.
 – Ensure all prerequisite ingredients and production machines are active to prevent inventory and crafting validation errors, as noted in previous cycles.
 – For Boiler and Offshore Pump relocation errors, preselect open, unobstructed regions and update entity statuses immediately after pick-up events to avoid using outdated candidate positions.
